{"editableAreas":[{"identifier":"top","sections":[{"identifier":"f998c5ce-d5c1-4ff0-b471-453d06a42c1d","type":"CommunityPortal.SingleColumnSection","properties":{"layout":"Standard","layoutParsed":0,"paddingTop":"Large","paddingTopParsed":0,"paddingBottom":"Large","paddingBottomParsed":0,"backgroundColor":"White","backgroundColorParsed":1},"zones":[{"identifier":"b832dcf9-2d97-4fe0-9cc1-42cba7cb3728","widgets":[{"identifier":"bc30ba0e-b257-4e35-967f-564a7ab5f220","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"2c2f43fa-d1f9-4034-af32-6caa8f7dfa5b","properties":{"markdown":"This year's Kentico Partner Connection is a 1 day event in each of our key regions. The technical track will feature micro-talks followed by a moderated group discussion on the talk topics.

Kentico will not be presenting during the technical track unless we do not have enough presenters, but we will help moderate the discussions.

### Event landing pages

* [Boston](https://www.kentico.com/kentico-partner-connection-na-2025)

* [Sydney](https://www.kentico.com/kentico-partner-connection-sydney-2025)

* [Prague](https://www.kentico.com/kentico-partner-connection-prague-2025)

Let us know which topic(s) you'd like to present on (you can combine multiple into a single presentation). We will decide on presentation length once we know the number of presenters, but it will likely be 6-12 minutes).

We will provide a PPTX template and coordinate with you if you need to use your own device. It is recommended to plan for a ***very short*** introduction in your presentation because of the limited time for each session.

resources","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"89699e31-cc00-4351-99d6-f666e623ea87"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"d14ef300-743f-48a1-a286-5b6b20a22700","headingLevel":"8415484d-bf78-4e85-8d53-26d7eb9fcc5f","headingLevelsParsed":"5d7fdd25-257d-4a5e-ac79-3500c6f8c191","headingAlignment":"59dafcad-901a-43e4-b243-e53d9e9b7059","headingAlignmentsParsed":"31f7ef7b-348d-4768-920b-f7383ceb4fe3","showHeadingAnchor":"f0b0eac7-e786-46dd-9b5d-84adfd251f7e","id":"fc7ad8b4-594d-4cde-9896-f7951f5684c6"}}]},{"identifier":"d489f179-8ec7-4974-9d59-e2bd1db4d019","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"3298a069-148a-4e97-b7a9-5ffad81aa8e3","properties":{"markdown":"We are very focused on enabling developers to deliver Xperience projects more quickly because this reduces cost for customers and helps agencies support more clients and projects. We believe AI adoption by digital agencies is the primary solution to increasing this agency speed of delivery, so **we are focusing on AI for sessions this year**.

Of course, any of these topics should be explained with examples from Xperience by Kentico.

* Your AI learning journey - challenges, eureka moments, and what you plan to explore next.
* Learning Xperience by Kentico with AI - how agentic tools can help onboard developers.
* Why developers *cannot* continue with pre-AI software development practices - what they are missing out on today if they fail to adopt AI
* The front line of developer AI-tools landscape (Copilot, Cursor, Claude Code) - explain the pros/cons of each.
* Can AI *really* improve our teams' Xperience project delivery speed and quality?
* The current shift towards agentic software development is both similar to and different from past shifts in software development.
* Best practices for getting the most out of AI technology on a development team or as an individual.
* How can I keep up with all the changes in AI development technology?
* The future is now - AI software development trends over the next 6, 12, and 24 months for digital agency teams.
* Essential non-coding AI tools or workflows that help solution delivery teams beyond their IDE.
* When to vibe code, use agentic co-development, and take full control?
* Cutting through the hype - how you can tell what AI tools are worth learning and investing in as a digital agency?
* How to build an AI-supported customer experience in Xperience by Kentico (search, digital commerce, automation, forms, support chat).
* How to build an Xperience web experience that supports GEO and the AI-search future?
* How to use AI to extend Xperience's administration (UI customization) - successes and challenges.
* AI only works for developers using React and Tailwind - dispelling myths and showing how AI is effective on Xperience projects.
* Can AI write documentation, commit messages, PR descriptions, automated tests, and other things you don't ship to production?
* Bridging the gap - what motivates some developers to experiment with and adopt AI technology or causes others to be skeptical and avoid it? How do you get teams to share these perspectives and help everyone grow?

## Key resources

Please build on any insights you've shared with us at Kentico or publicly in blog posts or socials.

Here are some resources worth considering to supplement your presentations.

If you have questions about our roadmap, strategy, etc... message Sean!

* [Native MCP server for documentation in September Refresh (Xperience roadmap)](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/338-provide-documentation-and-guides-through-the-kentico-knowledge-mcp)
* [Supercharge your Workflow: AI for Strategy and Code](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/americaneagle-com_dexterity-kentico-americaneagle-activity-7361014908454400002-bemo)
* [Xperience by Kentico Migration Project: Extracting Structured Data from Unstructured Rich Text](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/milanlund_contentmigration-xperiencebykentico-llmintegration-activity-7350766353332543488-lR8s/) - Milan Lund covers using Google's Gemini AI LLM to extract structured information from unstructured data during migration projects
* [Stop asking how AI can help you. Start asking how you can help AI (LinkedIn)](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/stop-asking-how-ai-can-help-you-start-matej-stefanik-tzayf) - Discussion about evolving mental models for AI adoption and productivity
* [We should drive the AI, not the other way around (LinkedIn)](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/milanlund_at-least-im-not-the-only-one-activity-7342893422858428416-p3Pp) - Milan Lund shares lessons learned using AI to build Xperience by Kentico and the importance of maintaining balance
* [Beyond the Build - Building AI Ready Websites with Mike Wills](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7292640195990941696) - Webinar discussing SGE (Search Generative Experience) and AI considerations for modern websites
* [Why I’m fine paying 3× more for my AI tool](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/milanlund_everyones-mad-at-cursor-right-now-activity-7360585265574223873-UNOf)
* [AI and the CMS (LinkedIn)](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/liamgoldfinch_cms-activity-7282902903109873664-lVSp) - Liam Goldfinch shares thoughts on how the AI revolution will impact the DXP and CMS space
* [AI adoption: Challenges](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/ai-adoption-challenges-matej-stefanik-uc85e/) - Discussion of key challenges organizations face when adopting AI technology
* [Community MCP Server](https://github.com/seangwright/xperience-community-mcp-server)
* [Turn your Xperience by Kentico application into an MCP Server](https://community.kentico.com/blog/turn-your-xperience-by-kentico-application-into-an-mcp-server)
* [Security threats when using AI to generate code](https://community.kentico.com/blog/security-threats-when-using-ai-to-generate-code)
* [Explore Xperience by Kentico with a SQL Server MCP](https://community.kentico.com/blog/ai-experiences-xperience-with-a-sql-server-mcp)
* [Evolving Dancing Goat with agentic AI software development](https://community.kentico.com/blog/evolving-dancing-goat-with-agentic-ai-software-development)
* [AI assisted improvements to the Kentico Community Portal](https://community.kentico.com/blog/ai-assisted-improvements-to-the-kentico-community-portal)
* [Enhance Kentico Development with a Custom AI Chat Mode in GitHub Copilot](https://community.kentico.com/blog/enhance-kentico-development-with-a-custom-ai-chat-mode-in-github-copilot)
